lines.gurmukhi: jnnI suqih jau iDkwr mwir ipAwru krY ipAwr iJrkwru dyiK skq n Awn ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jananee Soutahi Jau Dhikaar Maari Piaaru Karai , Piaar Jhirakaaru Daykhi Sakat N Aan Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mother scolds and spanks the child but cannot tolerate anyone else scolding, spanking and loving him.

lines.gurmukhi: jnnI ko ipAwru Aau iDkwr aupkwr hyq Awn ko iDkwr ipAwr hY ibkwr pRwn ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jananee Ko Piaaru Au Dhikaar Oupakaar Hayta , Aan Ko Dhikaar Piaar Hai Bikaar Praan Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Mothers scolding and spanking of the child is for his benefit but when someone else does it, it is indeed painful.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jl Agin mY prY bUf mrY jrY qYsy kiRpw kRop Awin binqw AigAwn ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jal Agani Mai Parai Bood Marai Jarai , Taisay Kripaa Krop Aani Banitaa Agiaan Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: (Although water is cold and fire is hot) falling in water drowns while jumping into fire burns a person to death. Similarly it is foolish to believe on the kindness or anger of another woman. (It is utter foolishness to lay faith on any other god/goddess

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisKn kau jugvq jqn kY duibDw n ibAwpY pRym prm inDwn ko ]355]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikhan Kau Jougavat Jatan Kai , Doubidhaa N Biaapai Praym Param Nidhaan Ko ?355?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just like mother, the True Guru makes every effort and attaches the Sikhs in the love of the Supreme Lord, the source of everything. And thus they are never infatuated or attracted by the love or anger of any god/goddess or spurious saint. (355)
